reviewText:
A game best played with friends imo. Dont get me wrong random people is also a fun experianse in its own right but usually i find that playing with friends leads to more comical events.

anyways the game is about the townies vs the evil forces trying to kill them be it the mafia, the serial killer, whicked jesters, executioners, werewolves, vampires, etc. But your not alone. evil doesnt always play well against itself either. So deception is the name of the game.

People can ask you your roll, and you can be honest, or deceitful. And just because you died doesnt mean thats the end of you. Your death note could point the blame at someone, You could tell who killed you to the medium, who will tell the rest of the townies. OR you can lie, just to mess with people. Your choice. :D

The Game is free on their website and is great for those times when you just need to kill some time.

all in all I'd definatly recommend.

reviewText:
Town of Salem. It's fun in a Guess Who" sort of way.

Pretty much two teams of people (and some unaffiliated people) in a town trying to collect information or convince the others of this or that.

No one knows what anyone else is at first. Everyone chooses a name
recommended:
and you're given a random role which no one knows but you.

There's a buncha roles. With each having their own ability and goal. Some need to lynch or kill the enemy team. Some just need to survive to the end of the game regardless of which team wins. Some even win by getting lynched.

Roles basically boil down to either collecting information
hoursPlayed: attacking other players
voteText: defending other players
helpfulPercent: blocking other players from performing their actions
votesHelpful: or misleading other players. All of which are done in various ways.\n\nThis game has the effect much like Civilization. You keep deciding to play just one more game (or "turn" in Civ's case) but before you know it you've played 10 more games. Especially if you play with friends and laugh over the dumb names people use and the silly last-wills and death-notes they make."

reviewText:
Quickie Review: Amazing game. Available for free on browser, but I highly recommend buying it on here to support the developers. If you want to get a general idea about what this game plays like, I made a short video of me playing it with some friends down below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TbOQCT5P6zM

Longer Review: This game has been some of the most fun I've had playing games with friends in recent memory. The amount of deception, lies, debauchery, and betrayal make the game SO much fun. If you've got friends you can play this game with, I'd give it a 9/10 easy. Alone it's probably still about an 8.

If you don't know what the game is about, you're essentially trying to either lynch the serial killer/mafia members (as well as other roles depending on your gametype) or, alternatively, trying not to get lynched while you blame the innocent and kill them while they sleep. It's just a really fun take on an old party game, and a welcome addition to my Steam library and regular game rotation.

That's another thing, the wealth of gametypes that the game offers more than makes it worth the $5. There's something for everyone. I personally really like the All Any" gametype
date: because it requires a lot more detective work and teamwork by the townies.\n\nIt's just completely different than every other game in my Steam library
recommended: so it stands out as something I really
hoursPlayed: really enjoy."

Town of Salem: The ultimate game of trying to read into people typing text.

People will almost do anything to try and save their asses, or kill someone's elses.

As a player on the web based version, ToS is a fun game lasting anywhere from 10-25 minutes per game. With the developers constantly adding content, the future of this game is looking bright.

If you enjoy deception, strategy and pixelated violence, this is the game for you.

The $5 cost will net you 1,200 game coins which will enable you to buy various skins from the store.

If you like CoD, or any other FPS, stay away from this game. This is not for you.

reviewText:
**WARNING**

DO NOT BUY OR PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE NOT PREPARED TO STAB YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY IN THE BACK AND LIVE WITH IT


I was hounded to play this game for almost a year.

I finally saw it during a steam sale for $3 but it came with $5 of in game coins so i thought why not.  Well all i can say is it was the best money i have spent.

town of salem as the description states is like the game Mafia, no not the video game the Party Game wher eyou have to use deception or investigation to win the game.

Play it with friends and you will probably no longer be friends with them
Play it with strangers and laugh when you kill them all or lynch them

You will learn how to lie and lie convincingly. You will also learn to how to spot lies.

So down to the game:

Up to 15 people in a game it is actually best with 15 and also the most fun, generally 4 evil roles (3 mafia and a serial killer), 1 executioner who is trying to get a town member Lynched, 1 jester who is trying to get lynched and 9 town members.  With less players there will be less roles available for both town and others.

Each role will tell you what you can do but i would adviselooking up the roles and how they work on the main website before you play as there really is no tutorial on how to play. Custom games have more roles to choose from  and can be a lot more intresting.  You do have to have played 40 games before you can play ranked but that i guess id for the real try hards and i just enjoy playing it for fun.

Pros

+ game is technically free you can play free version or pay up to 5 bucks on steam and get 5 bucks of in game cash
+ earn in game cash for every win, first win of day and several achievements
+ in game cash is used to buy skins, pets and basic eye cany stuff so you cant pay to win as it gets you nowhere
+ seems like there is a ranked system and also custom game mode where you can set as many roles as you like
+ you can kill your friends and laugh about it when you have lied to them the whole game
+ you can get revenge on a friend who killed you in a previous game
+ community is not so harsh on new players well not that i have seen anyway
+ you can get killed or lynched and still get a win
+ easy to pick up and learn on the go
+ you can use a different name each game

cons

- lots of rage quitters people dc at start of game or when they get killed
- no tutorial to tell you exactly how to play
- you will loose friends if you play this game
- you see the same names being used a lot

would i recomend this game oh hell yes this is not a game about high end graphics it is all about role playing and deception, have fun murder your friends,  lynch them, haunt them from beyond the grave, tell on them while you are dead, execute them while you have them in jail,  shoot them when they come to visit or just go and shoot them if you get a feeling  about them but heck you may not have any of those options.

Give it a shot and have some fun it is well worth it.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Town of Salem is massively enjoyable, especially when you consider how it manages to create mystery, suspense and strategic situations with so little. Each role (mostly) has an interesting thing to do, some roles are dull and are based entirely on luck and nothing else, but overall, you can develop your own strategy for each character and use it to the advantage (or disadvantage) of the group. Right, it is a really good game. Really engaged and good fun to play with...however...

What ruins the game is the sheer level of cheating and bad form displayed by a lot of players. I've had the good fortune to play with some excellent players and have great games. But on the majority of occasions, I end up stuck with some really rude, bigotted, spamming and sometimes peadophillic people. I report them of course, but the next game or so, there they are again, and aiming to ruin the game for me because I called them on it.

In some games as well, people actually cheat by telling people IRL who did what. For example, N1 as SK I killed the escort. Escort did not leave a will, ya know, the main way of communicating after you die (less the medium) and I got lynched because another person in the game was sat in the same room as the escort, and the escort told him. After trying to defend myself, as you would if you want to try to win, I was labelled a '♥♥♥' and told to 'go cry yu f***, b***** die in a fire' and so on...as if I chose to be the SK and then was totally in the wrong for trying to escape a lynching!

This is the only element of the game I find completely offputting, that this is going on, and it ruins games and throws it into complete bias. Everybody should have a fair shot at winning, and not get screwed over so easily by people who use their own mechanics to swing games. Adding in the fact that you get personally attacked by these people for actually trying to play the game. I know that monitoring a chat service is difficult and rely's on the players reporting, but the report function is not sufficient, especially when you can't give a reason for the report. And I am aware that there is no real way that the developers can stop this from happening, same as WoW can't really do much against gold farmers.

I would recommend it, but I do hope the developers are aware that this type of player ruins it for everybody else, and is, as such, the only, albeit quite seriously so, offputting part of the game.

reviewText:
Where do i start with this magnificent game? Well, here i guess. Town of Salem is a simplistic game where you click and type, easy right? If you said yes, you're wrong. This game is all about deceiving others, figuring out others plans and them revealing them to your side. Just gonna put it blunt, it F*cks with your mind, this game has a lot of tricks up its sleeves.... From surprising plot twists to last minute turn arounds, the games in this could go ANYWHERE.

The player customizer is spectacular, the options are just incredible and with new update every holiday and so often, you can never have enough skins or pets. It may be hard working for it, but you can't help but grin when you walk into that circle with a doge or a huge dark horse descending down on your fellow townies.

So now, why you should buy the game over playing in browser; No ads, Free money, Faster loading speed, another way of connecting with the amazing, mind boggling people you meet on the games and basically, overall enjoyment

My rating for this game is a mighty 9/10, this is because of the sheer enjoyment of the game, i have met several friends on this game and have played with cool youtubers like SquirrelsMK, because of the awesome party feauture, its certain that she can play with her subscribers and they can enjoy playing aswell, rather than just joining at the same time, hoping for the best. But, sadly, i can not give a perfect 10 for some games being ruined as of cheaters in the games, and i know its nearly impossible to prevent at the start of the game, but me and squirrels alike have had mafia, sk or just any games ruined by other mafia members or cheaters. That sums up my review, this game is perfect solo or with friends in a party.

reviewText:
It's a great game. I absolutely love it. I see a lot of people complaining about the ads, but as far as I can tell, those don't exist. Other people are complaining about scrolls, which is honestly a dumb thing to complain about because it doesn't affect the other players that much, unless there's like four people with the same scroll. In classic, if there's one person with a scroll, it changes the odds of everyone else getting that role from 7% to 4%, which isn't a huge dip. I've seen a few people complain about having to wait five minutes after leaving a game to join a new one, but since that timer starts ticking as soon as the game begins, those five minutes are hardly even a factor unless you leave on night 1 or 2.
I don't really have anything I can complain about. It's just a solid game that I've reccomended to all my friends.

Final rating: 9.6/10

10/10

reviewText:
It's a great game. I absolutely love it. I see a lot of people complaining about the ads, but as far as I can tell, those don't exist. Other people are complaining about scrolls, which is honestly a dumb thing to complain about because it doesn't affect the other players that much, unless there's like four people with the same scroll. In classic, if there's one person with a scroll, it changes the odds of everyone else getting that role from 7% to 4%, which isn't a huge dip. I've seen a few people complain about having to wait five minutes after leaving a game to join a new one, but since that timer starts ticking as soon as the game begins, those five minutes are hardly even a factor unless you leave on night 1 or 2.
I don't really have anything I can complain about. It's just a solid game that I've reccomended to all my friends.

Final rating: 9.6/10

reviewText:
I've racked up eleven hours on this game plus a few more before linking to Steam and right now I'm really enjoying it.

(Right now is 5.30am on Sunday morning. If writing this review to wean me off Town of Salem so I can go to bed.)

Basically what we have is a 'Werewolf' style game but with none of the tiresome eye-closing/eye-opening and far less opportunities for cheating.

There are fifteen players in a game and each is assigned a role at random. The roles fall into three categories, Good Townspeople, Mafia and Neutrals.

- Good Townspeoples' goal is to kill all the Mafia and the Serial Killer (a Neutral)
- Mafia's goal is to kill al the Good Townspeople and the Serial Killer
- Each Neutral has their own goal, specific to their role

Some roles have the ability to kill other characters during the night, some characters are immune to being killed during the night but any player can be hung by hue and cry during the day if the majority of the town (including Mafia and Neutrals) agrees on it. This is where the real fun comes in. However well you deploy your role abilities, there's always the chance that you might be put on the spot and accused of being a traitor to the town. You often find yourself with little more than a few second to explain your actions (or tell a convincing lie) before the rope is around your neck. There's nothing more satisfying than talking yourself out of trouble when standing on the gallows. (Especially if you deserve to be there.)

In summary, buy this. It's not expensive and it's really good fun.

reviewText:
**WARNING**

DO NOT BUY OR PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE NOT PREPARED TO STAB YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY IN THE BACK AND LIVE WITH IT


I was hounded to play this game for almost a year.

I finally saw it during a steam sale for $3 but it came with $5 of in game coins so i thought why not.  Well all i can say is it was the best money i have spent.

town of salem as the description states is like the game Mafia, no not the video game the Party Game wher eyou have to use deception or investigation to win the game.

Play it with friends and you will probably no longer be friends with them
Play it with strangers and laugh when you kill them all or lynch them

You will learn how to lie and lie convincingly. You will also learn to how to spot lies.

So down to the game:

Up to 15 people in a game it is actually best with 15 and also the most fun, generally 4 evil roles (3 mafia and a serial killer), 1 executioner who is trying to get a town member Lynched, 1 jester who is trying to get lynched and 9 town members.  With less players there will be less roles available for both town and others.

Each role will tell you what you can do but i would adviselooking up the roles and how they work on the main website before you play as there really is no tutorial on how to play. Custom games have more roles to choose from  and can be a lot more intresting.  You do have to have played 40 games before you can play ranked but that i guess id for the real try hards and i just enjoy playing it for fun.

Pros

+ game is technically free you can play free version or pay up to 5 bucks on steam and get 5 bucks of in game cash
+ earn in game cash for every win, first win of day and several achievements
+ in game cash is used to buy skins, pets and basic eye cany stuff so you cant pay to win as it gets you nowhere
+ seems like there is a ranked system and also custom game mode where you can set as many roles as you like
+ you can kill your friends and laugh about it when you have lied to them the whole game
+ you can get revenge on a friend who killed you in a previous game
+ community is not so harsh on new players well not that i have seen anyway
+ you can get killed or lynched and still get a win
+ easy to pick up and learn on the go
+ you can use a different name each game

cons

- lots of rage quitters people dc at start of game or when they get killed
- no tutorial to tell you exactly how to play
- you will loose friends if you play this game
- you see the same names being used a lot

would i recomend this game oh hell yes this is not a game about high end graphics it is all about role playing and deception, have fun murder your friends,  lynch them, haunt them from beyond the grave, tell on them while you are dead, execute them while you have them in jail,  shoot them when they come to visit or just go and shoot them if you get a feeling  about them but heck you may not have any of those options.

Give it a shot and have some fun it is well worth it.

reviewText:
Have you ever managed to perfectly manipulate someone to get the result you want? Obviously this doesn't happen much in real life (unless you are a lawyer) but Town Of Salem takes it to an art form. Manipulation, deceit, trickery and misdirection all play a huge part in this online-only multiplayer game of psychology and basically being a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

With a few different game modes to mix it up (as well as some custom ones you can host for others), the usual set-up is a town... the town of Salem in fact. This town has a slight problem. There are the good, honest, regular townies that live there... and then it seems that the mafia have moved into town and a serial killer is on the loose. The catch? Nobody knows who has what role in the town and they have to convince, lie, backstab and otherwise manipulate their way to living through each night, during which some unlucky sod will die.

Different roles for all the factions (teams?) have different abilities which they use to further their side's goals, but who to trust and who to suspect. This leads to some very tense games and shock endings. Great fun alone or with friends :P

reviewText:
Ever since Steam recommended this game to me it's claimed a portion of my daily life.

It's a game that reminded me of Mitadake High (Pyrce High I think it's called now over on the BYOND webiste) except better mechanics and a helluva lot more orgainzed. There's light role playing to figure out who's who, who should be hung or killed and the ability to take notes, all in the name of trying to win the game. Whether you're Mafia, a Townie, or some non-denominational bad or good guy, The whole goal of the game is achieve your objective and win the game. That could mean tricking people into lynching you, setting people on fire, survive the whole game without dying, or a myriad of other objects as there are tons of roles.

You don't get to pick your role. It's randomly chosen for you. You're given a box that tells you what it means, what you can do, and how to win the game. The best part of this game, is you don't always have to be alive to win. For instance, if you are aligned to win with Town and you die but Town survives, then you also have won the game.

But I don't wanna sit around and watch a game I'm not playing." I might hear you say. But what if I told you that sometimes there's a Medium that can talk to the "dead" and you can give them info to help the living people win? But sometimes the Medium's Curse is strong and they get killed first night. So that can suck if you know exactly who killed you but you can't tell anyone.

This game is definitely a must have in my book. It's less complicated then it sounds and totally addictive. If you like RPG elements
date: sprinkled with a board game atmosphere and Whodunit mysteries
recommended: give this game a shot.\n\nP.S. If you don't want to buy it
hoursPlayed: it is free to play here: http://blankmediagames.com/  Though if you do buy it on Steam

reviewText:
This game certainly is more than just interesting. I haven't played a similar game before, even though now I know there were games like this before. What at first seemed like a small little time waster, soon became one of my most played games.

In this game everyone in a village of 15 players gets a role which has each 1 special ability. You have 2 factions like Mafia and Townsfolk and certain unique roles like Werewolf and Serial Killer etc. This game is all about psychology and lying to others and finding out who is who because nobody knows for sure who can be trusted and everyone could be the serial killer, or belong to the mafia. During night time everyone can use their special ability, which can be anything depending on the role (kill someone, transport someone, protect, investigate, jail, douse, revive a dead, talk to dead etc etc).

Each day people can discuss about what happened, if they noticed anything etc. and then they can (but don't have to) vote to lynch/hang someone. But mind you, there is also a role called Jester, someone who's goal it is to get the others to lynch him.

Each round you play feels fresh and is fun as you usually get a new role each match. (there are 32 roles currently). Most roles are pretty fun to play.

I can only recommend this game. If you want to try it out for free there is a browser version free to play of this game. The steam version for 5€ is basically the same, but more stable since it's not browser related, no ads and you get 5€ of ingame currency for cosmetic changes like skins or pets etc.

reviewText:
I usually don't write reviews, and i apology if my grammar fails me somewhere, but this game deserves it.

Town of Salem is a game where 15 people are divided in to 3 groups: Townies, Mafia, and Neutral roles.
Each side has multiple roles befitting that faction, neutral being a special case. Townies are requiered to eliminate mafia and evil neutral roles, Mafia needs to kill all of the Townies (and evil roles that are a treat to the family) while each Neutral role has a specific goal, wheter it is to be the last man standing or simply survive until the game ends.

After joining the lobby the match starts once 15 people are gathered (unless the hosts decides to start sooner with fewer people but please don't do that). You choose the name you'll have during that match, for each match you can choose a diffrent name, and after that you'll get assigned a role and a game can start. In game phases are divided in to day time and night time when each role, if able, performs its ability. During the day all of the players gather to share informations, talk, lie and acuse each other. At the end of a discussion phase" players vote who to send to the block
date: and if more than half players vote someone out that someone is given a chance to defend himself. Players then vote if the acused one is guilty or innocent. If voted guilty he is executed and if not he is released. During the night time Mafia gathers to discuss their plans such as who will they murder next
hoursPlayed: who will be framed and so on. But Mafia members aren't the only night owls

reviewText:
Ever since Steam recommended this game to me it's claimed a portion of my daily life.

It's a game that reminded me of Mitadake High (Pyrce High I think it's called now over on the BYOND webiste) except better mechanics and a helluva lot more orgainzed. There's light role playing to figure out who's who, who should be hung or killed and the ability to take notes, all in the name of trying to win the game. Whether you're Mafia, a Townie, or some non-denominational bad or good guy, The whole goal of the game is achieve your objective and win the game. That could mean tricking people into lynching you, setting people on fire, survive the whole game without dying, or a myriad of other objects as there are tons of roles.

You don't get to pick your role. It's randomly chosen for you. You're given a box that tells you what it means, what you can do, and how to win the game. The best part of this game, is you don't always have to be alive to win. For instance, if you are aligned to win with Town and you die but Town survives, then you also have won the game.

But I don't wanna sit around and watch a game I'm not playing." I might hear you say. But what if I told you that sometimes there's a Medium that can talk to the "dead" and you can give them info to help the living people win? But sometimes the Medium's Curse is strong and they get killed first night. So that can suck if you know exactly who killed you but you can't tell anyone.

This game is definitely a must have in my book. It's less complicated then it sounds and totally addictive. If you like RPG elements
date: sprinkled with a board game atmosphere and Whodunit mysteries
recommended: give this game a shot.\n\nP.S. If you don't want to buy it
hoursPlayed: it is free to play here: http://blankmediagames.com/  Though if you do buy it on Steam

reviewText:
Town of Salem is a crafty and fun Mafia game that actually is more challening than you think to win. Since whoever wins largely depends on deceit, craftiness, and player guillibility, no game is ever the same. I have had the Serial Killer and Mafia both die on the first day by trying to kill a Veteran and we won the match on the first turn after a Mafia was lynched and the other mafia left the game.

HOWEVER, this game is also free in browser and you do not have to pay the $5 to buy it on steam. Paying the $5 actually doesn't get you many perks at all; it only gives you some coins which cannot actually buy you much. Not sure why they are charging $5 but other than that worth the play.

Rating: 8.7/10

reviewText:
Hey guys

So, before I go on, I have more than the 46 hours shown (as of review being written) on Town Of Salem, since I played the browser version a crap ton.

So..... Town of Salem is a game where you are given a role, and depending on the role, your either with The Town, who wants to live, or a killing role/Neutral role, where Ou are against town, and want to kill them. As Town, you must work together by using your abilities to determine who the mafia, serial killer(s), arsonist(s)etc are.
If you Don't like thinking games or teamwork, than I would not reccomend this game to you.

Pros:
Friendly Community
Friendly Developers
Good Soundtrack
Good and creative roles
Great Concept
Addicting and fun

Cons:
-AFK people can screw over Town and Mafia members
Ex: afk investigator won't be getting any info, while an afk Mafioso or God father prevents disguises, forgers, and Janitors from doing their jobs
- Trolls and Spammers, not only do they ruin chat, and block information, but people suspect them of Jesters and lunch them, resulting in either jester winning or a waste of a lynch
- Gamethrowers
Ex: Dead GodFather releases the names of remaining Mafia members on his last will
-Community is a little small, but still is pretty friendly for the most part


I'd say if you want an addicting game of murder and deception, buy Town of Salem, or play the web version for free

7.5/10

reviewText:
Before you buy it, beware that you can actually play this game online for free. I recommend trying it out online and if you like it considering buying it on Steam. The Steam version features quicker loading times, ability to invite friends to games easier, and no ads.

Pros:

- Not a bad community
- Great strategic potential
- Variety between games and roles
- Plenty of replayabilty
- Cheap (Free on browser)
- Good to play with friends
- Music is mostly fine

Cons:

- Visuals are meh
- A small minority of people get angry over small things
- Microtransactions (Not pay to win)
- In some cases slightly advantages people who have played more (Scrolls)

Overall Ratings:

Visuals: 6/10
Gameplay: 8/10

reviewText:
Imma start this off by explaining a couple of things.
1. The 2 things that are REALLY important to the game is price OR a low price, This game is $5 (I got for $2.50 Steam sale) and I could play this for hundreds of hours
2. I like to list PROs, CONs and RECOMMENDATIONS

PROS:
- Large amount of characters and content
- Great art design
- Great game idea
- Cheap price
- Although there is a lot to learn and you have to decieve people, it's not too hard to get a grasp on for new players
- Lots of players
- Many reliable servers

CONS:
- The login menu is kinda silly (Read recommendations)
- They use a high price of IRL money for a low amount of ingame money (eg $5 for around 1300 gold)
- Before logging in, there is no music volume setting, you have to log in to access it
- When given a day duty (Jailor) it's easy to forget to do said duty

RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Delete the need to login, make the account name the same as the steam name
- Right before night, do a pop-up asking Jailor to choose
- Lower the $ per Gold to around $1 for $2000. Although other games (CS:GO for example) are reliant on like $50 for a gun, this game will NEVER gain much from high prices for skins. It's more like the kinda game where people pay their $5, almost everyone has heard of it and only around 20% of your audience will STAY for more than 200 hours.

MOST IMPORTANT RECOMMENDATION
- You dont want people swearing on your game, that's all fine and dandy but theres a better way not to expose your younger audience to bad language. Lemme put it into steps

1. When the game is started for the first time ever, ask the player if they want to see curses or not
2. - If YES, when someone swears the player will see the entire message
- If NO, then the word will be taken out and replaced with *'s or spaces.

WHY? This means that the adult audience dont feel the need to dumb down the F word to fak, ♥♥♥♥, fech etc. (thus infuriating them) whilst the children arent seeing the curse.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Town of Salem is one of the most amazing adaptations of games such as Werewolf and Mafia combined together. The game consists of rounds where 15 players attempts to perform their roles depending on the team assigned. The game has a lot of good mechanics , however it can take quite a bit of time to learn the role due to the fact that each role is different . Essentially the town is attempting to survive the night while dealing with various threats (werewolf,mafia,executioner,arsonist,jester,serial killer as well as different townies) .

The game overall can be tricky early since it relies on manipulation of the other players in order to achieve their goal which can lead to people acting like new players (people trying to get killed on purpose) , random accusations in order to shift blame and also people randomly executing other possible suspects (vigilante/jailor). Sometimes it can become frustrating since people dying early usually quit which can remove some clues and make the game harder for some, easier for others.

The game also has a will used by the individuals which is usually used (recommended) to write the person's name and role and also clues on what he/she did each day in order to either help villagers get rid of the evil individuals or to confuse them.

The game has a store but everything bought in is simply cosmetics, such as a different house , different layout for the map, a pet (decorate), costumes and even a different way to get executed, so nothing changing the rules . Keep in mind, the game is actually free, the steam version comes with some points that can be used in the shop to buy decorative items.

Overall, this is a great game to play with friends (nothing better to create a feud than backstabbing friends) and it is also a great game to play with randoms. Some games can be bad and have trolls, but overall I had a great experience overall. I would recommend this game to everyone.

For our popular daily giveaways and similar reviews head over tohttp://www.steamified.com/

reviewText:
A town of peace and chaos all in one bundle, it's like playing Clue all over again as a kid. This game is a bundle of laughs and incredibly fun. I don't have the best patience but it really takes a lot of pushing to test mine in here. I strongly recommend playing this game for yourself on the browser first if you don't want to pay, if you enjoy the game, I strongly recommend buying it here. It's worth it.

Pros:

- Unique game aspect
- Colorful art and fun music
- Most people are respectful to each other, even in game
- Simple UI
- Not terribly grindy to obtain gold
- Regular sales making certain expensive packages super affordable
- Several roles to play as

Cons:

- Bugs here and there
- Requires strategy, lot of people in Classic think pointing fingers on the first day is the best idea, it's not.
- No freedom to swear, not a big deal but it sucks having to watch my own mouth
- Can be difficult to maintain your role and your will at once, depending on your role.
- Far too much marketing
- Not enough gold rewards for playing the game

Again I strongly recommend this game, and if by some chance, my review led you to Salem, please use my name as the referal. :3 Name is kayanakoe in game. I would love to try playing a game or two with you guys as well.

Update: I forgot to mention something, the game tends to be heavy on marketing so.. any gold income you would try to gain legitimately is low, 5 gold if, IF you win. So gl trying to get passed the newly found greed... I still play but the marketing is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ me way the ♥♥♥♥ off now.

reviewText:
Hey guys

So, before I go on, I have more than the 46 hours shown (as of review being written) on Town Of Salem, since I played the browser version a crap ton.

So..... Town of Salem is a game where you are given a role, and depending on the role, your either with The Town, who wants to live, or a killing role/Neutral role, where Ou are against town, and want to kill them. As Town, you must work together by using your abilities to determine who the mafia, serial killer(s), arsonist(s)etc are.
If you Don't like thinking games or teamwork, than I would not reccomend this game to you.

Pros:
Friendly Community
Friendly Developers
Good Soundtrack
Good and creative roles
Great Concept
Addicting and fun

Cons:
-AFK people can screw over Town and Mafia members
Ex: afk investigator won't be getting any info, while an afk Mafioso or God father prevents disguises, forgers, and Janitors from doing their jobs
- Trolls and Spammers, not only do they ruin chat, and block information, but people suspect them of Jesters and lunch them, resulting in either jester winning or a waste of a lynch
- Gamethrowers
Ex: Dead GodFather releases the names of remaining Mafia members on his last will
-Community is a little small, but still is pretty friendly for the most part


I'd say if you want an addicting game of murder and deception, buy Town of Salem, or play the web version for free

7.5/10

reviewText:
Product received for free

Full disclosure: I received the Steam version of this game as a gift.  I would not have purchased this version had it not been given to me and instead used the free version on the developer's website.

In short, Town of Salem has a very toxic community, which ruins the fun and charm of it.  It also has a LOT of AFKers in normal.  Don't play solo.  However, it is a very fun party game with friends.  Private lobbies with friends are incredibly fun.  Public lobbies?  A waste of time.

It's free on their own website, so don't buy it here.  Instead, just play it for free over at https://www.blankmediagames.com.  No need to waste $5.

reviewText:
Town of SalemTown of Salem is a fun multiplayer game with a lot of replayability,especially if you play it with friends.When you start a match,you get a random role and you need to guess who the others are in order to win the game.Each role has their unique abilities.Some roles are more fun than others,and some roles require you to cooperate with your team mates.Lynching is a great game mechanic becasue you can eliminate one person each day and speed up the process of finding the enemy.Usually a full game lasts for about 5-15 minutes.You can die early and leave the game though.

The CommunityThere is a chance that you'll encounter people that throw the game or that won't communicate,and that can make the game unfun.Usually you will have fair games.

The DevelopersThey update the game on a regular basis as of this review.They tweak game mechanics and add more content to the game regularly.

Browser version VS the Steam VersionTown of Salem is free on browser so it's not worth to buy it on Steam.The only features that Steam offers are : Steam Ovelay and Steam Achievements.

Even if the game is free elsewhere,I can't rate this negatively because it is a fun game.You can get the game cheap from bundles/resellers or even during Steam sales

reviewText:
okay, so I've played about 160 hours on this game and i still hop onto it every now and again
PROS:
-unique take on mafia cardgame
-requires you to work with other players and make decisions based on evidence
-simple in design and execution
-random role generator maximizes replayability
CONS:
-horribly toxic community (people still unironically talk in old, outdated memes)
-since there is 15 ppl, theres always 1-3 people that quit immediately or are afk the whole game
-majority of the community is either senile older ppl that expect everyone to be perfect, or 12 year olds spamming the chat
-the game relies on the players to play along with the rules and for the community to police itself, meaning the devs actually do very little to eliminate griefers and gamethrowers, reporting people does nothing anyways
although it is a unique game that is the first of its kind I CANT recommend this game to people because
1.) the game is literally free on their website
2.) the community has become overrun by trolls, making hard to find a lobby full of players trying to play it right, thus essentially making the game unplayable

reviewText: I highly recommend this game because it's fairly cheap and provides hours of fun whether you're alone or with a friend. reviewText:
Town of Salem will never become boring.
Over 300 hours outside of Steam, and 43 on here, and I've never had a round that seemed like a repeat.

The mafia may win because the jailor executed your mayor night 2.
The serial killer may win because he was AFK until the final night, and no one knew he was there.
Town may win because the vig killed 3 mafia in a row.
Survivor may win because the final werewolf and bodyguard killed eachother off.
Jester may win because the transporter screwed with a sheriff's investigation.
Mafia might win because the consig was yelling that he was consig since day 1 and didn't get killed.
Serial Killer might win because he was found out night 3, but there's so many jesters it doesn't matter.
Jester may get killed by mafia night 1, but win the next game by claiming jester as arsonist.
Executioner may win day 2 because the 6 mafia followed his vote.
Arsonist may loose because he doused the other two arsonists without knowing, and ingited.
Werewolf may win because the entire town attacked him in one full moon.
Town may win because the transporter reverse killed the only mafia member night one.

Every round has had some unique touch, and I believe I will never become bored of this game.

reviewText:
Yes, only purchase this game through Steam if you would like to help support the devs. Otherwise, go to their website at blankmediagames.com and play it free there. If you use info sheets and the ToS Wiki during the game like I do, press the ESC button to resize the screen when playing through the Steam client. You can then cycle through your needed tabs with ease.

If you like detective games you may love ToS. I've never played an in-person version of Werewolf or Mafia but I have tried other versions that were or are out there on the web. I keep coming back to ToS. The other ones are too confusing to navigate, have a stiff learning curve or you get in trouble by longtime regulars for having a new account by threatening to report you for just trying to play because you couldn't possibly be a brand new player. And their games typically last only about 5 minutes. While that can be a good thing, I find that it's just too quick for me to be as deceitful as possible in only a couple of minutes.

Each game in ToS takes around 30 minutes to complete and I personally do not believe that there are any boring roles. Each role is unique and while some are more aggressive roles, that means there has to be a balance of more passive roles. But each role plays an important part when played correctly or creatively. The only thing that makes a role boring is if you die on the first or second night. Those deaths are usually just the luck of the draw. But, that's just part of the game. Join another one and try again.

I love getting creative with roles. For example, when I'm Survivor I like to be as vocal as possible. When I'm Jester, I like to be as quiet as possible. It's all in how you want to play around with human psychology within the rules of the game. I've seen games with just two Mafia members win and games where seven Mafia lost (All Any mode).

I've seen my fair share of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ry ingame but the dev team cares about their community and are very responsive. There are now profanity filters that you can choose to have on and there has always been a report button for cheaters and the really out-of-hand players. Mostly, people are just playing a personality role while they are alive and if they stick around while dead, you can have some sane and interesting conversations.

In the end, it's just a game. If someone is being a ♥♥♥♥, /ignore them and move on to the next game when the time comes. Each game is different and that's what is so enjoyable. Just remember to have fun and play your part as best you can.

All the world’s a stage
date: \nAnd all the men and women merely players;\nThey have their exits and their entrances
recommended: \nAnd one man in his time plays many parts..." ~Shakespeare"

reviewText:
TL;DR
Score

✰85%✰

Party based game where you lie and trick your way to victory, or convince everyone else you're telling the truth. What is there not to like about this? Addictive and fun.

Pros

Gameplay interactions with other players
Tricking and decieving people
Every game and outcome is different
Scroll/odds rebalancing can stifle chances of certain roles

Cons

Highly dependant on other players not ruining the experience
Annoying pop up adds whether you paid for it on steam or play it for free

Gameplay
This originally started off as a browser game, which proved to be such a hit with the people who played it, that they wanted to help support the creators to get onto Steam and Mobile - so it could become more well known. With a successful kickstarter and greenlight, the goal was finally achieved! Perhaps in the future it will make it to other platforms, too.

Don't let my time here fool you. I have just a little over a thousand matches played at this point in time from the browser version. So, where to begin?


Well, first off, this is a party game based on the likes of Mafia. It's played with up to fifteen people, though you wouldn't want to have any less in order to have the best kind of game. The current updated version of this game starts you with the ability to choose your name – which can result in some hilarious trolling, depending on your mood. You know something's happening when half of the players decide to call themselves after Game of Thrones characters, or someone has a name that automatically makes others hate them.


After that, you have the role-wheel, which will select you your role for the game. This can be skewed in favour of those who have brought scrolls from the in-game shop to try and increase their chances of landing the role they want. For example, every role can have a 7% chance of being selected for you. If you use a scroll, it can increase the odds of the role you want to say, 20%, whilst decreasing the odds for everyone else – so they would drop from 7% to 4%. This can be annoying if you prefer to not obtain scrolls – but honestly, there is so many roles to choose from, it shouldn't matter too much. At some point, you will have roles you don't want, and roles you love. That's part of the fun of a randomised selection. The shame about this is that you will get pop up adds to entice you into the shop to buy things.


After finding out which of the 33 roles you are, you then act as according to it for the game. Each game can be anything between ten to thirty minutes long. The main game is split into several phases. You start off with:


Day One: discussion. Then night one. Then day two: Deaths. Then discussion. Then voting. Then discussion – this cycle repeats right up until the ultimate winner(s) are declared. Depending on your role, will depend on when you can preform your actions – if you have actions to achieve. With the voting phrase, if someone is voted up, they have to defend themselves, and the other players will vote guilty or innocent. Guilty votes will kill the defendant, and innocent ones will spare them.


You have three “sides” to speak of. Side one is town, or the “good” side. Town's main job is to oust the bad side before the bad side kills them. The catch is, Town has no clue who is Town and who isn't. So through discussion and usage of roles, they have to work out who is telling the truth and who is lying. You can get Support roles, Protective roles, and killing roles.


Side two is Mafia, the “bad” side. Mafia's main job is to kill every town member and persuade them all the while that they're Town. Mafia's average number is three. Their advantage over Town is that the Mafia know who each other is, and can communicate with each other at night. You can get Deception roles, Support, and Killing.


Side three is Neutrals, who all have individual goals that can either tie hand in hand with Town or Mafia, or just benefit themselves. You can get Benign neutrals, Killing neutrals, or just plain Evil ones.


Because there are so many roles, I will just mention around two from each “side” as a small example of the kinds you can get.


One role Town can get is an Investigator. During night-time, they can choose to look at another player to determine what role they have. A successful invest will reveal up to three roles the person can be. For example, someone could show up as Vigilante (Town Killing), a Veteran (Town Killing) or a Mafioso (Mafia Killing.) Through guesswork and questions, you can figure out if the person is good or not. Another town role is the Jailer. At daytime, they can choose to jail whoever they think is suspicious, or someone random. At night, they can then question the person in their jail to try and figure their role out. If the Jailer suspects their captive of lying, then they can choose to execute them.


For the Mafia, they can have a Godfather, who is the leader. He can kill someone at night, or make a Mafioso do it for them. Their advantage is that they can't be killed at night, so if someone shot them, they would be immune. The Disguiser for Mafia is someone who can take on the name, position, and face of someone who died. So if a confirmed Town player is chosen to be killed, the Disguiser can choose to “become” that Town, and people would believe they were still the same player.


For Neutrals, you can get an Jester, whose goal is to be hung by everyone else. They can do this by being annoying or throwing false information. If they are hung, they can choose to kill a guilty voter at night, from the graveyard. You can also get a Serial Killer, whose goal is to kill everyone – Town and Mafia. Serial Killers are also immune at night.


So, yes. There's a lot of roles. But really, the main selling point of this game is not the graphics, the music, or the diversity of the roles. It's the interaction with other players. Every single game is different because it depends on each player's ability to successfully do their role, and convince others of the truth, or their lies. It's a game about deception, and the feeling you can get when you pull off a tricky deception is just amazing. Imagine the Town's surprise when you convince them you're just a poor doctor who wants to heal people – and actually turn out to be the Serial Killer. Poor things. Maybe there's not a lot of good to be said about a game that teaches you how to lie convincingly, but trust me. This is fun!


A very important things players need to do is write their findings or information down in their last wills. That way, if they die, the information can be read by everyone else, and hopefully benefit whoever needs the information the most. (For example, an investigator may have found the Godfather, but isn't sure, so they write it down. And when they die, people can see they suspected someone of being a Godfather.)


You'll get people who leave if things don't go their way, or people who game throw, so quite a few times, a game will depend on the personalities of those you interact with. I've had some frustrating games where people ruin it for others, and awesome games where everyone is doing what they should be doing – and injecting a little fun into it, too.


I honestly think everyone should try this game at some point. It's free as well since it's still browser based. I chose to buy the game here because I loved it, and wanted to support BlankMediaGames. You have absolutely nothing to lose from trying this game out. And if you play with friends, you may end up damaging friendships, but that's okay. They'll forgive you … in time.


Go play!


Want moar? Click here to join my steam group and Click here to follow my curator page!

reviewText:
Fun game, fun concept. The game's options of Classic and Ranked, Chaos and Custom allow for various experiences and levels of idiocy ranging over the online players you will - unfortunately -  encounter.

At first, everything is really new and confusing. Once you get into the groove, things shift and you suddenly get better and more serious about the game. You realize that literally everyone online is a f***ing ♥♥♥♥♥ or a troll. You'll shrug, rant in the dead chat about how stupid that tarnation jailor was for killing you so early on in the game.
Then you play even more. You start playing as a troll jester just for kicks, even though you're a maf and should stay shut up.
Then these little kicks turn into your style of playing and before you know it, you're communicating with nothing but ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) faces and asking strangers online to touch your digital butt.

I lay awake in the middle of the night thinking of how this game has haunted me body and soul, thinking of how I was once a good person, of how I was once so pure and full of life...
If only the money I spent to purchase this downward spirale into internet-shitpostitude was worth my sufffering, my decline into horrible, impetuous, morbid meme'ing, and the emaciation of my self-respect.

10/10 would recommend. Super addictive.

reviewText:
This game is awesome, it tests all your analytical skills to find out if people are telling the truth
I would recommend everyone to try the game for free on the internet and buy it on steam if you like it to support the developpers.

The games are 7-15 people and there are different game modes
the one i play the most is chaos --> all any

the possible roles are very diverse and fall in 3 main categories (evil, neutral, town)
because of the amount of roles available every game is different and it doesn't get boring

even after putting more then 300 hours in it (played it already before it got on steam) i am sometimes still get caught off guard when the person who died didn't have the role i thought he had

although it is true you can play this game for free on the internet i still bought it on steam in a sale because i wanted the steam achievements. some of them are very hard to get (Example: as a janitor cleaning your own body)

reviewText:
Town of Salem is a cartoony witch trial simulator. Quick matchmaking and large community fills up the wait queues very fast. Roles are handed in secret, play your role and help your team wins. The learning curve is very manageable as most of the roles are intuitive enough.

Value is not very clear here as the concept is a rip off from SCII custom map and the dev decided to add a cash shop on top of the game not being free to play. You can earn the rewards through enough grind and the rewards are mostly cosmetic except for an item which lets you pick a role.

All in all I have a lot of fun in this game, and everything that ruins other communities like immaturity and trolling end up reinforcing this game's concept, making the trials hilarious and all in all people really do want to play their roles and win so the competitive edge can be very present, and when things go wrong then it is comedy gold even when the reasons are a little dubious. If you find this in a bundle I would say you owe it to yourself to try this. However if you own starcraft II already you might find this version of the game is slightly underpar in comparison to the free custom map. Its up to the dev to raise the bar for its steam release.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The ultimate test of deduction, forgery, and patience. Placed in a town of 7-15 people, you must either try to kill everyone on the oposing 'groups' while lieing about your role, or try your hardest to get the rest of the town to belive you while trying to hang the killers of the town.
Will you feel the joy of making it to the end unharmed? Will you feel satisfaction knowing that, despite your death, you were able to pull enough evidence to get the killer hanged? Or wil you just get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ when the town fails to listen to your clues, and hangs you instead.
Basically, its a fun game, but it can be a little frustrating when town members fail to work together. Its a simple concept, but it can be difficult to learn. If you end up playing it, I suggest reading some guides first.


Also, I would recommed trying the free version first which you can play in your browser. Consider the Steam version a 'donation' to the wonderful developers of the game, even though you do end up getting some in game money from it!

reviewText:
I really love that game, each game is really different from one an other, you always have different roles and have to adapt your strategy depending on which side you are on, trying to find who's on your team, who to trust, who to betray, who to lie to?

Your strategy didn't work out and/or someone question your role and the folks of Salem put you on trial? You have a fair trial and again you have to try to convince them not to lynch you...

No matter if you're a good role or a bad guy this game will bring you lots of excitement, you can try out the browser version for free (I don't have the address), if you buy the game on Steam it's to support the devs and having some in-game money to buy cosmetics, scrolls and items.

For bringing such a nice game, i say these guys deserve it.

Have a great day

reviewText: This is my 4th review in my past 3 years of being active on steam. As i've already stated in my previous review, i'm not the review-everything-i-bought" kinda guy. I only write review on specific games that really caught my attention
date:
it can be either too brilliant or too toxic. So here we go.

Finding out this game on steam was like the best thing i had in quite a while (it was actually my friend V.n who first told me about this hidden gem). It is simply a genius board game inspired by the traditional "Werewolf Game by Miller".
If you never heard about that game
recommended: it is basically a complicated version of TTT mode on Gmod: "There is a killer amongst you whom you should find out ASAP before he/she kills everyone including yourself."\nIf you love to play with your brain
hoursPlayed: read people's mind
voteText: gain people's trust
helpfulPercent: twist the way people think toward you or others

votesTotal: this is definitely the game for you.\nHowever
votesFunny: this game is not as simple as a "murderer vs innocent" game. They have 30+ different roles that you must adapt with if you want to survive (check them out here http://town-of-salem.wikia.com/wiki/Roles).\nThere are countless amount of possibilities in this game (there's never been a similar round which means one round will go differently than the other) to make this game less-boring.\nThe only negative stuff about this game is the UI bug. Sometimes it is hard to invite your online friends into lobby just because they dont show up on the friend list. Despite

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nI got this as a gift from a friend who gave it to me and to some other friends so we could all play together. I started this game not really knowing what to expect, as soon as I opened it - instant regret. As soon as I opened the game I got absolutely BLASTED with music. Next was the horrible log in / registration screen which completely failed to inform me about the right course of actions needed to start playing the game. After 5 minutes of trying to figure out how to get to the main menu I finally made it. The menu is hurrendous and looks like a web game from when people were still trying to figure out how to use the internet. The whole package just screams f2p, from the horrible login to the in game currency that can be used to get cosmetics and scrolls (which I don't know what they're used for - because it didn't say anywhere). All in all the experience was very bad, and I have asked my friend to refund it because I really don't want this game in my library.

reviewText:

Only daunting thing can be learning what all the roles do as a new player, but it's quite easy to get the hang of after a few games. Devs seem to be supporting it regularly too with upcoming new roles, skins and other cool additions.

Many good times had, would recommend again.

reviewText:
I would rate this game higher if it weren't for the fact that it is glitchy and freezes all of the time. I spent $5 to support the devs but they don't seem to spend nearly as much time working on the game itself as they do creating new skins and other purchasable content. I get that it costs money to keep such a popular game running but the game freezes and it is incredibly frustrating if you've won or nearly won and then have to leave the game before it is over. The community is awful and toxic from most of my experience as well.

A lot of people complain about the daily ads as well, which I don't really mind, but they always pop up mid game which is very frustrating.

Otherwise it is very fun and a great idea, I just wish it was better executed and that they would spend more time fixing the glitches and issues and less time adding MORE roles/ buyable items. Every time they add a role or a function it seems to break the game a little.

reviewText: Town of Salem is a murder-mystery party game. You have between 7 and 15 players divided up among different factions in the town, such as arsonists, neutrals, mafia members, etc. You don't know who is who, but your role is to track down and take out the other villains before they kill you. You also have Serial Killers who sneak around at night and try to murder you. There are over 30 different roles making the game diverse and unique each time you play. Visually, it looks like a facebook game, but isn't to bad. I had fun playing it for a little bit and will probably come back to it again, because it can be challenging.

reviewText:
Town of Salem is either a game that you will love or a game that you won’t like. Most people I have introduced the game to have immediately gotten addicted to it. It is a simple clicking game; however, it does involve a lot of thinking. It is a who-did-it type of game. There are a variety of game modes. You can play as many different characters, good, bad and neutral. Also there are coins earned in game that you can use to buy new skins, pets, and other features to customize your game experience.

I recommend playing it for free on the browser first, before you purchase it on steam so you are sure you don’t waste your money if you feel like you don’t like the game. The difference between the browser version and the steam version is that you can earn 220 achievements on steam. It also says that when you first purchase the steam version you get extra coins, although I’m not sure if that is still active or not.

You should definitely give this game a chance. Playing it with friends makes it even more fun.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
My Review/Thoughts On Town of Salem (ToS)
Key Points     Gameplay
Controls
Community
My Personal Opinion
Overall Thoughts
Gameplay:So to start off, as the game information mentions there are a total of 31 unique roles for you to play as all with different ablities and perks. There is the Town, the Mafia, the Serial Killers, the Arsonists and the Neutrals. Within those are the mentioned 31 different roles.
You can start by playing a pretty good ammount of gamemodes when you start up the game. The ones you can play are Normal Classic, Custom Custom (pick from any 31 roles), Custom Rapid (faster times), Chaos All Any (Any role can be given), Chaos Rainbow (roles that make the rainbow), and Chaos Vigilantics (Vigilanties vs Witches). There is one more gamemode you can play call Normal Ranked however you need to play at least 50 games to start playing ranked.
Once you're in a game you have the option to make a last will, this is basically where you can store your information during the night and it stays. The will is essentail to the game because it could make the differance between a loss and a win. If/when you die your will, will be shown to the town. During the day time you can talk with the 7 to 15 players  (the dead cannot) and discuss what happened over night. At the end of the discussion" time you have the option of voting someone
date: if you have no proof of them being what they are acused of then this is a random lynch and those are annoying af.\n\nControls:It's almost like a point and click game
recommended: although there is a chat for you to talk to people in the game as well as message friends. Honestly the chat is pretty important as you will be needing it for every game. There's really not much to the controls I guess.\n\nThe Community:Oh boy where to start with this one.... Hm ok
hoursPlayed: so some people are very nice and some are salty af. Most of the time you will find a nice lobby with pretty decent people. Other times you have trolls who don't care for the game or gamethrowers who just annoy everyone
voteText: there's also this other group called the afkers and they don't do anything all game (this mostly happens to people who dont get a good role). Recently the devs and other people who work on the game are working on something to help crack down on people like this. On a side note if you're new people are going to get mad at you because you didn't do something right. I suggest taking a look at this: Town of Salem Roles.[www.blankmediagames.com] There are also people who just love to random lynch and it honestly makes no sense to me.\n\nMy Personal Opinion:Let's start from the start. I started playing because I played one game on someones computer
helpfulPercent: and from then I was kinda hooked. Right after that match I went and bought it here on Steam. I was new and if you read my warning about new players you know how the first match went down. As I started playing more and more I learned the roles and what to do. You need to learn which roles are divided into the different groups so you can avoid lynches. I'm not calling myself good or anything of the sort
votesHelpful: but I've aquired some skill.\nAbout the roles now. To start off here I shall go into possibably the best role to be; the Mafia. Why the mafia you ask? Well the Mafia acts as a team and if you're working together and play your cards right it's very hard for people to even notice whats happening and by the time they do you the Mafia have won the game. Serial Killer
votesTotal: Vampires
votesFunny: Werewolfs
commentsCount: Arsonists
column16: and Witches are probably the next best thing to be. Werewolf and Vampires are sort of like the Mafia
column17: but they don't have fancy roles
column18: they just do the same thing. And if you're not one of those classes I am so sorry.\n\nOverall Thoughts:So what are my overall thoughts? I honestly love this game and I think it's worth it
column19: one thing worth addressing is that yes this game is on the internet and is free
column20: but if you buy the game on steam you get $5 worth of "Town Points" which is an ingame currancy used to spiffy up your character and such.\nMost of the time when you launch the game you will be given a pop up upon logging in with your steam account of your browser account. This just offers you bundles and things of the sort (If you sign in with Steam you can use Steam Wallet money for purchases).\nDepending on what time of day you play and other factors you can get a decent lobby with some nice people
column21: or it could be the complete oppisite. I've found the community to be very likeable and funny
column22:
the people that manage the ToS Twitter account are also very interactive with the players who tweet at them for help and other things so don't be shy!

In the end I give this game an 8/10.

Thank you for taking the time to read my review and I hope you pick up a copy of Town of Salem!"

reviewText:
The core gameplay is solid and quite fun as long as you're playing with Decent Players. (Note the emphasis.)

The truth of the matter is that cheating is rampant in this game, and the devs are either unwilling or unable to do anything about it. What's worse, the average age of a Town of Salem player (both mental and physical) is somewhere around the early teens, so don't expect any maturity from the playerbase.

This game has a long way to go before it can even be considered being worth $4.99.

reviewText:
This game can be a LOT of fun when people actually play it right!

1. The devs need to do something about the immature and offensive names that players choose.  They keep CLAIMING that they take reports seriously, but I have seen no evidence of them doing anything about it.

2. Something needs to be done about REPEAT quitters!  People who join a lobby and wait until the timer is at 2 seconds and then leave just to troll everyone else.  Not to mention in game quitters who leave before the game even goes to the first night because they don't like the role that they got.

3. Town members who are killed that quit.... something needs to be done about that as well.  It screws over the medium's role.  What point is there in having a medium if everyone who dies leaves the game because they are sore losers?

This game is meant to be fun for everyone who plays it.  But lately I have had the fun sapped out of it because of the above problems.  The devs keep claiming that they are going to impliment features that punish people who quit and use offensive names... but nothing has been done yet.  I have been playing this game for several months now on both Steam and Facebook.  It's time for the developers to take care of the trash players in this game so that the REAL players can fully enjoy it!

I won't recommend this game to a friend until the above problems are fixed.

reviewText:
This game is possibly the best multiplayer game I have played.

I stated watch videos of the game last year and was always tempted to try it so I gather a group of freinds and start. We played the browser version virtually non-stop for a couple of days. When I heard there would be a steam release I knew I would be getting it free or not. I was happy to contribute to the development of the game as it is still in early stages.

However, the community in the game can be considered the downfall of the game. There are some trolls, cheats and people who hate newbies, but after being open to these people many times before (in all sorts of games) I can tolerate their abuse. Most of thime the community will be joking around and having a jolly old time and these matches with trolls don't occur often.

My advise for anyone thinking of buying this game on steam is to first try the browser edition (that is free) and get a feel for the game first and if you want to help them develop this game then you can either purchase the town points in game of through steam.

Tips: Always be involved in the discussion if not you will be deemed suspicious and lynched instantly even if there is no evidence. Choose a different name each game to keep an interest and if playing with freinds keep you identity secret. Also try to be comical with your name or reference something (I tend to reference to things I like e.g. Game of Thrones, Monty Python, WWE ,etc.

Take this game for what it is, not what it isn't and you will enjoy it. (best £4 I have possibly spent)

reviewText:
I've been in love with Mafia ever since I played it in a drama class.
Ever since playing Starcraft II I found the Mafia arcade game and never played ladder on it again.
And just recently I discovered Town of Salem.
While it is cheap on Steam it is also free online - http://blankmediagames.com/TownOfSalem/
What you get for supporting the game by buying it is additional modes of customisation such as character skins, maps and varying death sequences (in addition to being hanged by the mob you may choose being squashed by a rock, being burned at the stake or drowned among other things). You are given a tidy sum of 'Town Points', the in-game currency gained by spending real-life money or else it slowly accumulates after many games which can be spent on these customisations.
It is not an action game and you must have patience but it is very rewarding.
Maybe you will believe me through the medium of haiku:
I said I was Vet
I lied I was really Vigi
Wow they sure got trolled

reviewText: One night I poured a little gasoline on this guy's head cause he was being a jerk.  The smell was so intoxicating that I decided to do it again the next night, and the next.  Then on the fourth night I was playing with a lighter thinking how wonderful it would be to see them all go up in flames... so I lit em up.  I knew the town would probably catch me, but I thought, hey the flames are worth it.  But that night there was an even bigger inferno than I expected.  It turned out half the town was burnt to cinders.  And they all left the same death note... which wasn't mine.  Somehow the townies caught on to the other arsonist and lynched him good, and then they thought 'good, we're safe now, we killed the bad guy'.  So I bided my time and doused some quiet ones until there were just four of us left.  I had doused 2 of them already, but I knew the mafia would know who I was the next day if I didn't kill them.  So I took the chance and lit them all up.  And low and behold, the mafia had decided to kill that very same fourth person who was left, leaving me all alone, Queen of the Fire.\n\nSeriously this game rocks, you can play it over and over again and no two games are the same.  Best $5 I ever spent on a free browser game (but I don't even care cause it's that good).

reviewText:
This game looks absolutely childish.

But in truth it actually has depth and fun.  It is a deceit and logic based game mix in some group lemming mentality and you have yourself hours and hours of fun.

I played 20 hours within a 30 hour time period.  It is that fun.  I have to actually force myself  to quit, it's that addicting.

These guys did a great job.  But it IS Free to Play.  Just not on Steam.  It is a browser based game and has a cash shop that only sells cosmetic items, and you earn enough coins to get those cosmetic items.

After about 50 matches I had enough to buy me a pet.  Just for cosmetic, as how you look or what you live in, or even your name in the game, has zero bearing on the outcome.  Each game lasts between 20-30 minutes.

If you dont want to pay the $5 from steam (you get $5 worth of coins basically) then play it from their website, just google it.

reviewText:
First, know that Town of Salem is multiplayer-only (online).  That said, as someone who rarely-to-never plays multiplayer games, I was hooked from the moment a friend made me watch him play a match.  This is a game that would be impossible to do single-player, so give it a chance.  Now then:

It's a little hard to describe the fun of Town of Salem in words.  A match goes roughly like this:  First, you pick a nickname for yourself, so that each player can be anonymous.  Each player in the lobby is then randomly assigned a role.  Each role has different abilities, objectives, and victory conditions.  Some roles are teamed up with each other, some are lone wolves, and some are neutral" roles that can win with other teams surviving as long as they complete their stated objective.

At night

reviewText:
Enjoy party games?  Prefer them when there's total ambiguity and the ability to mess with people is heightened?

This is basically Mafia (the party game) online.  It has a few quirks and has the ugliest interface of anything you've ever considered buying on Steam.  Yes, it has a (free) web client you can use.  But honestly, for a few dollars you can pick it up, get some customisations with the in-game money (which you can also earn anyway), and get a client (which hopefully one day won't look dreadful).

This is a game you should buy if you care about GAMEPLAY and NOT graphics.  It's a game to let out your inner-sociopath, your inner-roleplayer that you deny having in social circles, or to release the inner-Dexter (if you luck into that role; boat not included).

reviewText:
In Town of Salem, you are given a role. Your role could be part of the town, like a doctor or a veteran, or part of something much more evil, like a serial killer or a mafia member. The game plays like a metaphorical game of cards. You could be the doctor, and be pressured by everyone else into revealing yourself; if you do, you could become a target for the bad guys, and if you don’t, the town could decide to lynch you.

Each game consists of a day/night cycle. During the day cycle, the players discuss the night’s happening and share their suspicions or evidence an evil character. During the night, everyone’s ability is used. Some abilities kill other players, while others simply block another person’s ability or discover a player’s role.

If the majority of players agree that a player is evil, then they could vote to put him on trial. When the trail is in progress, the accused can plead a case: then, the town votes if they believe the player is guilty or innocent. If the player is found innocent, the town can vote to put another person on trail. If found guilty, the player will be hanged and the day will immediately end.

reviewText:
I've been in love with Mafia ever since I played it in a drama class.
Ever since playing Starcraft II I found the Mafia arcade game and never played ladder on it again.
And just recently I discovered Town of Salem.
While it is cheap on Steam it is also free online - http://blankmediagames.com/TownOfSalem/
What you get for supporting the game by buying it is additional modes of customisation such as character skins, maps and varying death sequences (in addition to being hanged by the mob you may choose being squashed by a rock, being burned at the stake or drowned among other things). You are given a tidy sum of 'Town Points', the in-game currency gained by spending real-life money or else it slowly accumulates after many games which can be spent on these customisations.
It is not an action game and you must have patience but it is very rewarding.
Maybe you will believe me through the medium of haiku:
I said I was Vet
I lied I was really Vigi
Wow they sure got trolled
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Town of Salem is a game where you have to lie, deceive and frame others to reach your goal. The game isn't easy to pick up and it takes quite some time to get good at it and make use of certain strategies for each role. Aside from some people that trade information outside, the comunity is great and the puns come quick!\nIf you know you will spend quite some time playing it, there is no reason not to buy it. When your account is linked to steam you are able to leave games without getting penalized in-game currency and it really sucks because some people ruin games this way by rage quitting when they are given a bad role.\n

reviewText: Town of Salem is an overall great game, it's gamplay is simple but still very exciting, it has alot of different roles, it's developers actually care about their players (unlike some companies *cough cough* EA). I remember playing this type of game with my friends back in primary school, it was called Mafia. Anyways on with the actuall review, Town of Salem in steam is just as good as the browser version, but I am sure that the Steam version will be even better. At first I was quite sad and unsatisfied that the Steam actually cost real money, but when I bought it I didn't expect there to a reward for buying the game, which was 1500 Town of Salem funds, which costs the same as the game, so you basicly buy some funds and you get an improved version of Town of Salem. However all the good stuff aside, I am a little unpleased by the lack of new features, I hoped for an exit button to use while in a game.s
